Package optional

Class Problem

java.lang.Object
optional.Problem
public class Problem
extends java.lang.Object
A class that models instances of the Transportation Cost problem.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Problem()
    Default constructor that sets all fields to null.
    Problem​(Source[] sources, Destination[] destinations, int[] supply, int[] demand, int[][] cost)
    The constructor of an instance of the Transportation Cost Problem.

  • Constructor Details

    • Problem

      public Problem()
      Default constructor that sets all fields to null.

    • Problem

      public Problem​(Source[] sources, Destination[] destinations, int[] supply, int[] demand, int[][] cost)
      The constructor of an instance of the Transportation Cost Problem.
      Parameters:
      sources - are the Sources provided in the text.
      destinations - are the Destinations provided in the text.
      supply - are the corresponding supplies for each of the sources provided.
      demand - are the corresponding demands for each of the destinations provided.
      cost - cost[i][j] represents the cost of transporting a unit from source i to destination j.

  • Method Details

    • getSources

      public Source[] getSources()
      Sources getter.
      Returns:
      the sources provided in the problem.

    • setSources

      public void setSources​(Source[] sources)
      Optional task #1 - do not allow duplicates.
      Parameters:
      sources - an array of potential sources which has to meet the following conditions: 1) contains no duplicates. 2) has the same size as the current array (if it exists).

    • getDestinations

      public Destination[] getDestinations()
      Destinations getter.
      Returns:
      the destinations provided in the problem.

    • setDestinations

      public void setDestinations​(Destination[] destinations)
      Optional task #1 - do not allow duplicates
      Parameters:
      destinations - an array of potential destinations which has to meet the following conditions: 1) contains no duplicates. 2) has the same size as the current array (if it exists).

    • getSupply

      public int[] getSupply()
      Supplies getter.
      Returns:
      the supplies provided in the problem.

    • setSupply

      public void setSupply​(int[] supply)
      Supplies setter.
      Parameters:
      supply - the supplies for each source

    • getDemand

      public int[] getDemand()
      Demands getter.
      Returns:
      the demands provided in the problem.

    • setDemand

      public void setDemand​(int[] demand)
      Demands setter.
      Parameters:
      demand - the demands of each destination

    • getCost

      public int[][] getCost()
      Costs getter.
      Returns:
      the costs provided in the problem.

    • setCost

      public void setCost​(int[][] cost)
      Costs setter.
      Parameters:
      cost - the transportation cost matrix. cost[i][j] represents the cost of transporting a unit from source i to destination j.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A literal description of the problem given.
